byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and PETER BAKER

abstract: Death of Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia immediately ignites partisan battle, as Pres Obama vows to nominate successor during his remaining time in office and Republicans call for decision to be left to next president; departure of Scalia, one of court's most influential conservatives, opens opportunity for significant reshaping of court with his replacement; death is likely to influence course of 2016 presidential election as both parties leverage event to rally their bases.

headline.print_headline: Battle Begins Over Successor as Obama Vows to Press On
headline.main: Battle Begins Over Naming Next Justice

snippet: The death of Justice Antonin Scalia on Saturday immediately set off a partisan battle over a vacancy that could reshape the Supreme Court for years to come, as Senate Republicans called on President Obama to let his successor fill the seat.
lead_paragraph: The death of Justice Antonin Scalia on Saturday immediately set off a partisan battle over a vacancy that could reshape the Supreme Court for years to come, as Senate Republicans called on President Obama to let his successor fill the seat.
